channel.title: CVE Feed for pgadmin.org -- pgAdmin 4
channel.description: The latest CVEs for pgadmin.org -- pgAdmin 4

item.title: CVE-2024-9014|2024-09-23T17:04:00.264Z -- pgadmin.org -- pgadmin%204
item.description: pgAdmin versions 8.11 and earlier are vulnerable to a security flaw in OAuth2 authentication. This vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially obtain the client ID and secret, leading to unauthorized access to user data.

item.title: CVE-2024-3116|2024-08-19T07:47:48.299Z -- pgadmin.org -- pgadmin%204
item.description: pgAdmin <= 8.4 is affected by a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability through the validate binary path API. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server hosting PGAdmin, posing a severe risk to the database management system's integrity and the security of the underlying data.

item.title: CVE-2024-4215|2024-08-01T20:33:52.916Z -- pgadmin.org -- pgadmin%204
item.description: pgAdmin <= 8.5 is affected by a multi-factor authentication bypass vulnerability. This vulnerability allows an attacker with knowledge of a legitimate account’s username and password may authenticate to the application and perform sensitive actions within the application, such as managing files and executing SQL queries, regardless of the account’s MFA enrollment status.

item.title: CVE-2024-4216|2024-08-01T20:33:52.902Z -- pgadmin.org -- pgadmin%204
item.description: pgAdmin <= 8.5 is affected by XSS vulnerability in /settings/store API response json payload. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute malicious script at the client end.

item.title: CVE-2024-6238|2024-06-25T17:18:13.717Z -- pgadmin.org -- pgadmin%204
item.description: pgAdmin <= 8.8 has an installation Directory permission issue. Because of this issue, attackers can gain unauthorised access to the installation directory on the Debian or RHEL 8 platforms.

item.title: CVE-2024-4216|2024-05-02T17:42:59.679Z -- pgadmin.org -- pgadmin%204
item.description: pgAdmin <= 8.5 is affected by XSS vulnerability in /settings/store API response json payload. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute malicious script at the client end.
